subTopics.label: E1A
subTopics.description: Operating Standards: frequency privileges; emission standards; automatic message forwarding; frequency sharing; stations aboard ships or aircraft

questions.label: E1A01
questions.text: When using a transceiver that displays the carrier frequency of phone signals, which of the following displayed frequencies represents the highest frequency at which a properly adjusted USB emission will be totally within the band?
distractors: 300 Hz below the upper band edge
1 kHz below the upper band edge
questions.answer: 3 kHz below the upper band edge

questions.label: E1A02
questions.text: When using a transceiver that displays the carrier frequency of phone signals, which of the following displayed frequencies represents the lowest frequency at which a properly adjusted LSB emission will be totally within the band?
distractors: 300 Hz above the lower band edge
1 kHz above the lower band edge
questions.answer: 3 kHz above the lower band edge

questions.label: E1A03
questions.text: With your transceiver displaying the carrier frequency of phone signals, you hear a station calling CQ on 14.349 MHz USB. Is it legal to return the call using upper sideband on the same frequency?
distractors: Yes, because you were not the station calling CQ
Yes, because the displayed frequency is within the 20 meter band
No, U.S. stations are not permitted to use phone emissions above 14.340 MHz
questions.answer: No, the sideband will extend beyond the band edge

questions.label: E1A04
questions.text: With your transceiver displaying the carrier frequency of phone signals, you hear a DX station calling CQ on 3.601 MHz LSB. Is it legal to return the call using lower sideband on the same frequency?
distractors: Yes, because the DX station initiated the contact
Yes, because the displayed frequency is within the 75 meter phone band segment
No, U.S. stations are not permitted to use phone emissions below 3.610 MHz
questions.answer: No, the sideband will extend beyond the edge of the phone band segment

questions.label: E1A05
questions.text: What is the maximum power output permitted on the 60 meter band?
distractors: 50 watts PEP effective radiated power relative to an isotropic radiator
50 watts PEP effective radiated power relative to a dipole
100 watts PEP effective radiated power relative to an isotropic radiator
questions.answer: 100 watts PEP effective radiated power relative to the gain of a half-wave dipole

questions.label: E1A06
questions.text: Where must the carrier frequency of a CW signal be set to comply with FCC rules for 60 meter operation?
distractors: At the lowest frequency of the channel
At the highest frequency of the channel
On any frequency where the signal’s sidebands are within the channel
questions.answer: At the center frequency of the channel

questions.label: E1A07
questions.text: Which amateur band requires transmission on specific channels rather than on a range of frequencies?
questions.answer: 60 meter band

questions.label: E1A08
questions.text: If a station in a message forwarding system inadvertently forwards a message that is in violation of FCC rules, who is primarily accountable for the rules violation?
distractors: The control operator of the packet bulletin board station
The control operators of all the stations in the system
The control operators of all the stations in the system not authenticating the source from which they accept communications
questions.answer: The control operator of the originating station

questions.label: E1A09
questions.text: What is the first action you should take if your digital message forwarding station inadvertently forwards a communication that violates FCC rules?
distractors: Notify the originating station that the communication does not comply with FCC rules
Notify the nearest FCC Field Engineer’s office
questions.answer: Discontinue forwarding the communication as soon as you become aware of it

questions.label: E1A10
questions.text: If an amateur station is installed aboard a ship or aircraft, what condition must be met before the station is operated?
distractors: The amateur station operator must agree not to transmit when the main radio of the ship or aircraft is in use
The amateur station must have a power supply that is completely independent of the main ship or aircraft power supply
The amateur operator must have an FCC Marine or Aircraft endorsement on his or her amateur license
questions.answer: Its operation must be approved by the master of the ship or the pilot in command of the aircraft

questions.label: E1A11
questions.text: Which of the following describes authorization or licensing required when operating an amateur station aboard a U.S.-registered vessel in international waters?
distractors: Any amateur license with an FCC Marine or Aircraft endorsement
Only General class or higher amateur licenses
questions.answer: Any FCC-issued amateur license

questions.label: E1A12
questions.text: With your transceiver displaying the carrier frequency of CW signals, you hear a DX station's CQ on 3.500 MHz. Is it legal to return the call using CW on the same frequency?
distractors: Yes, the DX station initiated the contact
Yes, the displayed frequency is within the 80 meter CW band segment
No, U.S. stations are not permitted to use CW emissions below 3.525 MHz
questions.answer: No, one of the sidebands of the CW signal will be out of the band

questions.label: E1A13
questions.text: Who must be in physical control of the station apparatus of an amateur station aboard any vessel or craft that is documented or registered in the United States?
distractors: Only a person with an FCC Marine Radio
Only a person named in an amateur station license grant
Any person named in an amateur station license grant or a person holding an unrestricted Radiotelephone Operator Permit
questions.answer: Any person holding an FCC issued amateur license or who is authorized for alien reciprocal operation

questions.label: E1A14
questions.text: What is the maximum bandwidth for a data emission on 60 meters?
questions.answer: 2.8 kHz

subTopics.label: E1B
subTopics.description: Station restrictions and special operations: restrictions on station location; general operating restrictions, spurious emissions, control operator reimbursement; antenna structure restrictions; RACES operations; national quiet zone

questions.label: E1B01
questions.text: Which of the following constitutes a spurious emission?
distractors: An amateur station transmission made at random without the proper call sign identification
A signal transmitted to prevent its detection by any station other than the intended recipient
Any transmitted signal that unintentionally interferes with another licensed radio station
questions.answer: An emission outside its necessary bandwidth that can be reduced or eliminated without affecting the information transmitted

questions.label: E1B02
questions.text: Which of the following factors might cause the physical location of an amateur station apparatus or antenna structure to be restricted?
distractors: The location is near an area of political conflict
The location is of geographical or horticultural importance
The location is in an ITU Zone designated for coordination with one or more foreign governments
questions.answer: The location is of environmental importance or significant in American history, architecture, or culture

questions.label: E1B03
questions.text: Within what distance must an amateur station protect an FCC monitoring facility from harmful interference?
questions.answer: 1 mile

questions.label: E1B04
questions.text: What must be done before placing an amateur station within an officially designated wilderness area or wildlife preserve, or an area listed in the National Register of Historical Places?
distractors: A proposal must be submitted to the National Park Service
A letter of intent must be filed with the National Audubon Society
A form FSD-15 must be submitted to the Department of the Interior
questions.answer: An Environmental Assessment must be submitted to the FCC

questions.label: E1B05
questions.text: What is the National Radio Quiet Zone?
distractors: An area in Puerto Rico surrounding the Arecibo Radio Telescope
An area in New Mexico surrounding the White Sands Test Area
An area in Florida surrounding Cape Canaveral
questions.answer: An area surrounding the National Radio Astronomy Observatory

questions.label: E1B06
questions.text: Which of the following additional rules apply if you are installing an amateur station antenna at a site at or near a public use airport?
distractors: No special rules apply if your antenna structure will be less than 300 feet in height
You must file an Environmental Impact Statement with the EPA before construction begins
You must obtain a construction permit from the airport zoning authority
questions.answer: You may have to notify the Federal Aviation Administration and register it with the FCC as required by Part 17 of FCC rules

questions.label: E1B07
questions.text: What is the highest modulation index permitted at the highest modulation frequency for angle modulation below 29.0 MHz?

questions.label: E1B08
questions.text: What limitations may the FCC place on an amateur station if its signal causes interference to domestic broadcast reception, assuming that the receivers involved are of good engineering design?
distractors: The amateur station must cease operation
The amateur station must cease operation on all frequencies below 30 MHz
The amateur station must cease operation on all frequencies above 30 MHz
questions.answer: The amateur station must avoid transmitting during certain hours on frequencies that cause the interference

questions.label: E1B09
questions.text: Which amateur stations may be operated under RACES rules?
distractors: Only those club stations licensed to Amateur Extra class operators
Any FCC-licensed amateur station except a Technician class
Any FCC-licensed amateur station participating in the Military Auxiliary Radio System (MARS)
questions.answer: Any FCC-licensed amateur station certified by the responsible civil defense organization for the area served

questions.label: E1B10
questions.text: What frequencies are authorized to an amateur station operating under RACES rules?
distractors: Specific segments in the amateur service MF, HF, VHF and UHF bands
questions.answer: All amateur service frequencies authorized to the control operator

questions.label: E1B11
questions.text: What is the permitted mean power of any spurious emission relative to the mean power of the fundamental emission from a station transmitter or external RF amplifier installed after January 1, 2003 and transmitting on a frequency below 30 MHZ?
questions.answer: At least 43 dB below

subTopics.label: E1C
subTopics.description: Definitions and restrictions pertaining to local, automatic and remote control operation; control operator responsibilities for remote and automatically controlled stations; IARP and CEPT licenses; third party communications over automatically controlled stations

questions.label: E1C01
questions.text: What is a remotely controlled station?
distractors: A station operated away from its regular home location
A station controlled by someone other than the licensee
A station operating under automatic control
questions.answer: A station controlled indirectly through a control link

questions.label: E1C02
questions.text: What is meant by automatic control of a station?
distractors: A station operating with its output power controlled automatically
Remotely controlling a station’s antenna pattern through a directional control link
The use of a control link between a control point and a locally controlled station
questions.answer: The use of devices and procedures for control so that the control operator does not have to be present at a control point

questions.label: E1C03
questions.text: How do the control operator responsibilities of a station under automatic control differ from one under local control?
distractors: Under local control there is no control operator
Under automatic control there is no control operator
Under local control a control operator is not required to be present at a control point
questions.answer: Under automatic control the control operator is not required to be present at the control point

questions.label: E1C04
questions.text: What is meant by IARP?
distractors: The internal amateur radio practices policy of the FCC
An indication of increased antenna reflected power
A forecast of intermittent aurora radio propagation
questions.answer: An international amateur radio permit that allows U.S. amateurs to operate in certain countries of the Americas

questions.label: E1C05
questions.text: When may an automatically controlled station originate third party communications?
distractors: Only when transmitting RTTY or data emissions
When agreed upon by the sending or receiving station
When approved by the National Telecommunication and Information Administration
questions.answer: Never

questions.label: E1C06
questions.text: Which of the following statements concerning remotely controlled amateur stations is true?
distractors: Only Extra Class operators may be the control operator of a remote station
A control operator need not be present at the control point
Repeater and auxiliary stations may not be remotely controlled
questions.answer: A control operator must be present at the control point

questions.label: E1C07
questions.text: What is meant by local control?
distractors: Controlling a station through a local auxiliary link
Controlling a repeater using a portable handheld transceiver
questions.answer: Direct manipulation of the transmitter by a control operator

questions.label: E1C08
questions.text: What is the maximum permissible duration of a remotely controlled station’s transmissions if its control link malfunctions?
questions.answer: 3 minutes

questions.label: E1C09
questions.text: Which of these ranges of frequencies is available for an automatically controlled repeater operating below 30 MHz?

questions.label: E1C10
questions.text: What types of amateur stations may automatically retransmit the radio signals of other amateur stations?
distractors: Only beacon, repeater or space stations
Only earth stations, repeater stations or model craft
Only auxiliary, beacon or space stations
questions.answer: Only auxiliary, repeater or space stations

questions.label: E1C11
questions.text: Which of the following operating arrangements allows an FCC-licensed U.S. citizen to operate in many European countries, and alien amateurs from many European countries to operate in the U.S.?
distractors: All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: CEPT agreement

questions.label: E1C12
questions.text: What types of communications may be transmitted to amateur stations in foreign countries?
distractors: Messages intended for connection to users of the maritime satellite service
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Communications incidental to the purpose of the amateur service and remarks of a personal nature

questions.label: E1C13
questions.text: Which of the following is required in order to operate in accordance with CEPT rules in foreign countries where permitted?
distractors: You must identify in the official language of the country in which you are operating
The U.S. embassy must approve of your operation
You must append "/CEPT" to your call sign
questions.answer: You must bring a copy of FCC Public Notice DA 11-221

subTopics.label: E1D
subTopics.description: Amateur satellites: definitions and purpose; license requirements for space stations; available frequencies and bands; telecommand and telemetry operations; restrictions, and special provisions; notification requirements

questions.label: E1D01
questions.text: What is the definition of the term telemetry?
distractors: Two-way radiotelephone transmissions in excess of 1000 feet
Two-way single channel transmissions of data
One-way transmission that initiates, modifies, or terminates the functions of a device at a distance
questions.answer: One-way transmission of measurements at a distance from the measuring instrument

questions.label: E1D02
questions.text: What is the amateur satellite service?
distractors: A radio navigation service using satellites for the purpose of self training, intercommunication and technical studies carried out by amateurs
A spacecraft launching service for amateur-built satellites
A radio communications service using stations on Earth satellites for public service broadcast
questions.answer: A radio communications service using amateur radio stations on satellites

questions.label: E1D03
questions.text: What is a telecommand station in the amateur satellite service?
distractors: An amateur station located on the Earth’s surface for communication with other Earth stations by means of Earth satellites
An amateur station located more than 50 km above the Earth’s surface
An amateur station that transmits telemetry consisting of measurements of upper atmosphere data
questions.answer: An amateur station that transmits communications to initiate, modify or terminate functions of a space station

questions.label: E1D04
questions.text: What is an Earth station in the amateur satellite service?
distractors: An amateur station that is not able to communicate using amateur satellites
An amateur station that transmits telemetry consisting of measurement of upper atmosphere data
Any amateur station on the surface of the Earth
questions.answer: An amateur station within 50 km of the Earth's surface intended for communications with amateur stations by means of objects in space

questions.label: E1D05
questions.text: What class of licensee is authorized to be the control operator of a space station?
distractors: Only General, Advanced or Amateur Extra Class
questions.answer: Any class with appropriate operator privileges

questions.label: E1D06
questions.text: Which of the following is a requirement of a space station?
distractors: The space station must cease all transmissions after 5 years
The space station must be capable of changing its orbit whenever such a change is ordered by NASA
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: The space station must be capable of terminating transmissions by telecommand when directed by the FCC

questions.label: E1D07
questions.text: Which amateur service HF bands have frequencies authorized for space stations?
distractors: Only the 40 m, 20 m, 17 m, 15 m and 10 m bands
Only the 40 m, 30 m, 20 m, 15 m, 12 m and 10 m bands
questions.answer: Only the 40 m, 20 m, 17 m, 15 m, 12 m and 10 m bands

questions.label: E1D08
questions.text: Which VHF amateur service bands have frequencies available for space stations?
questions.answer: 2 meters

questions.label: E1D09
questions.text: Which UHF amateur service bands have frequencies available for a space station?
questions.answer: 70 cm and 13 cm

questions.label: E1D10
questions.text: Which amateur stations are eligible to be telecommand stations?
distractors: Any amateur station designated by NASA
Any amateur station so designated by the ITU
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Any amateur station so designated by the space station licensee, subject to the privileges of the class of operator license held by the control operator

questions.label: E1D11
questions.text: Which amateur stations are eligible to operate as Earth stations?
distractors: Any amateur station whose licensee has filed a pre-space notification with the FCC's International Bureau
Only those of General, Advanced or Amateur Extra Class operators
Only those of Amateur Extra Class operators
questions.answer: Any amateur station, subject to the privileges of the class of operator license held by the control operator

subTopics.label: E1E
subTopics.description: Volunteer examiner program: definitions; qualifications; preparation and administration of exams; accreditation; question pools; documentation requirements

questions.label: E1E01
questions.text: What is the minimum number of qualified VEs required to administer an Element 4 amateur operator license examination?

questions.label: E1E02
questions.text: Where are the questions for all written U.S. amateur license examinations listed?
distractors: In a question pool maintained by the FCC
In the appropriate FCC Report and Order
questions.answer: In a question pool maintained by all the VECs

questions.label: E1E03
questions.text: What is a Volunteer Examiner Coordinator?
distractors: A person who has volunteered to administer amateur operator license examinations
A person who has volunteered to prepare amateur operator license examinations
The person who has entered into an agreement with the FCC to be the VE session manager
questions.answer: An organization that has entered into an agreement with the FCC to coordinate amateur operator license examinations

questions.label: E1E04
questions.text: Which of the following best describes the Volunteer Examiner accreditation process?
distractors: Each General, Advanced and Amateur Extra Class operator is automatically accredited as a VE when the license is granted
The amateur operator applying must pass a VE examination administered by the FCC Enforcement Bureau
The prospective VE obtains accreditation from the FCC
questions.answer: The procedure by which a VEC confirms that the VE applicant meets FCC requirements to serve as an examiner

questions.label: E1E05
questions.text: What is the minimum passing score on amateur operator license examinations?
questions.answer: Minimum passing score of 74%

questions.label: E1E06
questions.text: Who is responsible for the proper conduct and necessary supervision during an amateur operator license examination session?
questions.answer: Each administering VE

questions.label: E1E07
questions.text: What should a VE do if a candidate fails to comply with the examiner’s instructions during an amateur operator license examination?
distractors: Warn the candidate that continued failure to comply will result in termination of the examination
Allow the candidate to complete the examination, but invalidate the results
Immediately terminate everyone’s examination and close the session
questions.answer: Immediately terminate the candidate’s examination

questions.label: E1E08
questions.text: To which of the following examinees may a VE not administer an examination?
distractors: All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Relatives of the VE as listed in the FCC rules

questions.label: E1E09
questions.text: What may be the penalty for a VE who fraudulently administers or certifies an examination?
distractors: A fine of up to $1000 per occurrence
A sentence of up to one year in prison
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Revocation of the VE's amateur station license grant and the suspension of the VE's amateur operator license grant

questions.label: E1E10
questions.text: What must the administering VEs do after the administration of a successful examination for an amateur operator license?
distractors: They must collect and send the documents to the NCVEC for grading
They must collect and submit the documents to the coordinating VEC for grading
They must collect and send the documents to the FCC according to instructions
questions.answer: They must submit the application document to the coordinating VEC according to the coordinating VEC instructions

questions.label: E1E11
questions.text: What must the VE team do if an examinee scores a passing grade on all examination elements needed for an upgrade or new license?
distractors: Photocopy all examination documents and forward them to the FCC for processing
Issue the examinee the new or upgrade license
questions.answer: Three VEs must certify that the examinee is qualified for the license grant and that they have complied with the administering VE requirements

questions.label: E1E12
questions.text: What must the VE team do with the application form if the examinee does not pass the exam?
distractors: Maintain the application form with the VEC's records
Send the application form to the FCC and inform the FCC of the grade
questions.answer: Return the application document to the examinee

questions.label: E1E13
questions.text: Which of these choices is an acceptable method for monitoring the applicants if a VEC opts to conduct an exam session remotely?
distractors: Record the exam session on video tape for later review by the VE team
The exam proctor observes the applicants and reports any violations
Have each applicant sign an affidavit stating that all session rules were followed
questions.answer: Use a real-time video link and the Internet to connect the exam session to the observing VEs

questions.label: E1E14
questions.text: For which types of out-of-pocket expenses do the Part 97 rules state that VEs and VECs may be reimbursed?
distractors: Teaching an amateur operator license examination preparation course
No expenses are authorized for reimbursement
Providing amateur operator license examination preparation training materials
questions.answer: Preparing, processing, administering and coordinating an examination for an amateur radio license

subTopics.label: E1F
subTopics.description: Miscellaneous rules: external RF power amplifiers; business communications; compensated communications; spread spectrum; auxiliary stations; reciprocal operating privileges; special temporary authority

questions.label: E1F01
questions.text: On what frequencies are spread spectrum transmissions permitted?
distractors: Only on amateur frequencies above 50 MHz
Only on amateur frequencies above 420 MHz
Only on amateur frequencies above 144 MHz
questions.answer: Only on amateur frequencies above 222 MHz

questions.label: E1F02
questions.text: What privileges are authorized in the U.S. to persons holding an amateur service license granted by the government of Canada?
distractors: None, they must obtain a U.S. license
All privileges of the Extra Class license
Full privileges, up to and including those of the Extra Class License, on the 80, 40, 20, 15, and 10 meter bands
questions.answer: The operating terms and conditions of the Canadian amateur service license, not to exceed U.S. Extra Class privileges

questions.label: E1F03
questions.text: Under what circumstances may a dealer sell an external RF power amplifier capable of operation below 144 MHz if it has not been granted FCC certification?
distractors: The equipment dealer assembled it from a kit
It was imported from a manufacturer in a country that does not require certification of RF power amplifiers
It was imported from a manufacturer in another country and was certificated by that country’s government
questions.answer: It was purchased in used condition from an amateur operator and is sold to another amateur operator for use at that operator's station

questions.label: E1F04
questions.text: Which of the following geographic descriptions approximately describes "Line A"?
distractors: A line roughly parallel to and west of the U.S. Atlantic coastline
A line roughly parallel to and north of the U.S.-Mexican border and Gulf coastline
A line roughly parallel to and east of the U.S. Pacific coastline
questions.answer: A line roughly parallel to and south of the U.S.-Canadian border

questions.label: E1F05
questions.text: Amateur stations may not transmit in which of the following frequency segments if they are located in the contiguous 48 states and north of Line A?
questions.answer: 420 MHz - 430 MHz

questions.label: E1F06
questions.text: Under what circumstances might the FCC issue a Special Temporary Authority (STA) to an amateur station?
distractors: To allow regular operation on Land Mobile channels
To provide additional spectrum for personal use
To provide temporary operation while awaiting normal licensing
questions.answer: To provide for experimental amateur communications

questions.label: E1F07
questions.text: When may an amateur station send a message to a business?
distractors: When the total money involved does not exceed $25
When the control operator is employed by the FCC or another government agency
questions.answer: When neither the amateur nor his or her employer has a pecuniary interest in the communications

questions.label: E1F08
questions.text: Which of the following types of amateur station communications are prohibited?
distractors: Communications that have a political content, except as allowed by the Fairness Doctrine
Communications that have a religious content
Communications in a language other than English
questions.answer: Communications transmitted for hire or material compensation, except as otherwise provided in the rules

questions.label: E1F09
questions.text: Which of the following conditions apply when transmitting spread spectrum emission?
distractors: A station transmitting SS emission must not cause harmful interference to other stations employing other authorized emissions
The transmitting station must be in an area regulated by the FCC or in a country that permits SS emissions
The transmission must not be used to obscure the meaning of any communication
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: E1F10
questions.text: What is the maximum permitted transmitter peak envelope power for an amateur station transmitting spread spectrum communications?

questions.label: E1F11
questions.text: Which of the following best describes one of the standards that must be met by an external RF power amplifier if it is to qualify for a grant of FCC certification?
distractors: It must produce full legal output when driven by not more than 5 watts of mean RF input power
It must be capable of external RF switching between its input and output networks
It must exhibit a gain of 0 dB or less over its full output range
questions.answer: It must satisfy the FCC's spurious emission standards when operated at the lesser of 1500 watts or its full output power

questions.label: E1F12
questions.text: Who may be the control operator of an auxiliary station?
distractors: Only General, Advanced or Amateur Extra Class operators
questions.answer: Only Technician, General, Advanced or Amateur Extra Class operators

subTopics.label: E2A
subTopics.description: Amateur radio in space: amateur satellites; orbital mechanics; frequencies and modes; satellite hardware; satellite operations; experimental telemetry applications

questions.label: E2A01
questions.text: What is the direction of an ascending pass for an amateur satellite?
questions.answer: From south to north

questions.label: E2A02
questions.text: What is the direction of a descending pass for an amateur satellite?
questions.answer: From north to south

questions.label: E2A03
questions.text: What is the orbital period of an Earth satellite?
distractors: The point of maximum height of a satellite's orbit
The point of minimum height of a satellite's orbit
The time it takes for a satellite to travel from perigee to apogee
questions.answer: The time it takes for a satellite to complete one revolution around the Earth

questions.label: E2A04
questions.text: What is meant by the term mode as applied to an amateur radio satellite?
distractors: The type of signals that can be relayed through the satellite
The satellite's orientation with respect to the Earth
Whether the satellite is in a polar or equatorial orbit
questions.answer: The satellite's uplink and downlink frequency bands

questions.label: E2A05
questions.text: What do the letters in a satellite's mode designator specify?
distractors: Power limits for uplink and downlink transmissions
The location of the ground control station
The polarization of uplink and downlink signals
questions.answer: The uplink and downlink frequency ranges

questions.label: E2A06
questions.text: On what band would a satellite receive signals if it were operating in mode U/V?
questions.answer: 435 MHz - 438 MHz

questions.label: E2A07
questions.text: Which of the following types of signals can be relayed through a linear transponder?
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: E2A08
questions.text: Why should effective radiated power to a satellite which uses a linear transponder be limited?
distractors: To prevent creating errors in the satellite telemetry
To prevent the satellite from emitting out-of-band signals
To avoid interfering with terrestrial QSOs
questions.answer: To avoid reducing the downlink power to all other users

questions.label: E2A09
questions.text: What do the terms L band and S band specify with regard to satellite communications?
questions.answer: The 23 centimeter and 13 centimeter bands

questions.label: E2A10
questions.text: Why may the received signal from an amateur satellite exhibit a rapidly repeating fading effect?
distractors: Because of the satellite's low orbital altitude
questions.answer: Because the satellite is spinning

questions.label: E2A11
questions.text: What type of antenna can be used to minimize the effects of spin modulation and Faraday rotation?
questions.answer: A circularly polarized antenna

questions.label: E2A12
questions.text: What is one way to predict the location of a satellite at a given time?
distractors: By means of the Doppler data for the specified satellite
By subtracting the mean anomaly from the orbital inclination
By adding the mean anomaly to the orbital inclination
questions.answer: By calculations using the Keplerian elements for the specified satellite

questions.label: E2A13
questions.text: What type of satellite appears to stay in one position in the sky?
questions.answer: Geostationary

questions.label: E2A14
questions.text: What technology is used to track, in real time, balloons carrying amateur radio transmitters?
questions.answer: APRS

subTopics.label: E2B
subTopics.description: Television practices: fast scan television standards and techniques; slow scan television standards and techniques

questions.label: E2B01
questions.text: How many times per second is a new frame transmitted in a fast-scan (NTSC) television system?

questions.label: E2B02
questions.text: How many horizontal lines make up a fast-scan (NTSC) television frame?

questions.label: E2B03
questions.text: How is an interlaced scanning pattern generated in a fast-scan (NTSC) television system?
distractors: By scanning each field from bottom to top
By scanning lines from left to right in one field and right to left in the next
questions.answer: By scanning odd numbered lines in one field and even numbered lines in the next

questions.label: E2B04
questions.text: What is blanking in a video signal?
distractors: Synchronization of the horizontal and vertical sync pulses
Turning off the scanning beam at the conclusion of a transmission
Transmitting a black and white test pattern
questions.answer: Turning off the scanning beam while it is traveling from right to left or from bottom to top

questions.label: E2B05
questions.text: Which of the following is an advantage of using vestigial sideband for standard fast- scan TV transmissions?
distractors: The vestigial sideband carries the audio information
The vestigial sideband contains chroma information
Vestigial sideband provides high frequency emphasis to sharpen the picture
questions.answer: Vestigial sideband reduces bandwidth while allowing for simple video detector circuitry

questions.label: E2B06
questions.text: What is vestigial sideband modulation?
distractors: A type of modulation in which one sideband is inverted
Narrow-band FM modulation achieved by filtering one sideband from the audio before frequency modulating the carrier
Spread spectrum modulation achieved by applying FM modulation following single sideband amplitude modulation
questions.answer: Amplitude modulation in which one complete sideband and a portion of the other are transmitted

questions.label: E2B07
questions.text: What is the name of the signal component that carries color information in NTSC video?
questions.answer: Chroma

questions.label: E2B08
questions.text: Which of the following is a common method of transmitting accompanying audio with amateur fast-scan television?
distractors: A separate VHF or UHF audio link
Frequency modulation of the video carrier
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: E2B09
questions.text: What hardware, other than a receiver with SSB capability and a suitable computer, is needed to decode SSTV using Digital Radio Mondiale (DRM)?
distractors: A special notch filter to remove synchronization pulses
questions.answer: No other hardware is needed

questions.label: E2B10
questions.text: Which of the following is an acceptable bandwidth for Digital Radio Mondiale (DRM) based voice or SSTV digital transmissions made on the HF amateur bands?
questions.answer: 3 KHz

questions.label: E2B11
questions.text: What is the function of the Vertical Interval Signaling (VIS) code sent as part of an SSTV transmission?
distractors: To lock the color burst oscillator in color SSTV images
To identify the call sign of the station transmitting
questions.answer: To identify the SSTV mode being used

questions.label: E2B12
questions.text: How are analog SSTV images typically transmitted on the HF bands?
distractors: Video is converted to equivalent Baudot representation
Video is converted to equivalent ASCII representation
Varying tone frequencies representing the video are transmitted using PSK
questions.answer: Varying tone frequencies representing the video are transmitted using single sideband

questions.label: E2B13
questions.text: How many lines are commonly used in each frame of an amateur slow-scan color television picture?

questions.label: E2B14
questions.text: What aspect of an amateur slow-scan television signal encodes the brightness of the picture?
questions.answer: Tone frequency

questions.label: E2B15
questions.text: What signals SSTV receiving equipment to begin a new picture line?
questions.answer: Specific tone frequencies

questions.label: E2B16
questions.text: Which is a video standard used by North American Fast Scan ATV stations?
questions.answer: NTSC

questions.label: E2B17
questions.text: What is the approximate bandwidth of a slow-scan TV signal?
questions.answer: 3 kHz

questions.label: E2B18
questions.text: On which of the following frequencies is one likely to find FM ATV transmissions?
questions.answer: 1255 MHz

questions.label: E2B19
questions.text: What special operating frequency restrictions are imposed on slow scan TV transmissions?
distractors: None; they are allowed on all amateur frequencies
They are restricted to 7.245 MHz, 14.245 MHz, 21.345 MHz, and 28.945 MHz
They are not permitted above 54 MHz
questions.answer: They are restricted to phone band segments and their bandwidth can be no greater than that of a voice signal of the same modulation type

subTopics.label: E2C
subTopics.description: Operating methods: contest and DX operating; remote operation techniques; Cabrillo format; QSLing; RF network connected systems

questions.label: E2C01
questions.text: Which of the following is true about contest operating?
distractors: Interference to other amateurs is unavoidable and therefore acceptable
It is mandatory to transmit the call sign of the station being worked as part of every transmission to that station
Every contest requires a signal report in the exchange
questions.answer: Operators are permitted to make contacts even if they do not submit a log

questions.label: E2C02
questions.text: Which of the following best describes the term self-spotting in regards to HF contest operating?
distractors: The acceptable practice of manually posting the call signs of stations on a spotting network
A manual technique for rapidly zero beating or tuning to a station’s frequency before calling that station
An automatic method for rapidly zero beating or tuning to a station’s frequency before calling that station
questions.answer: The generally prohibited practice of posting one’s own call sign and frequency on a spotting network

questions.label: E2C03
questions.text: From which of the following bands is amateur radio contesting generally excluded?

questions.label: E2C04
questions.text: What type of transmission is most often used for a ham radio mesh network?
distractors: Multiple Frequency Shift Keying in the 10 GHz band
Store and forward on the 440 MHz band
Frequency division multiplex in the 24 GHz band
questions.answer: Spread spectrum in the 2.4 GHz band

questions.label: E2C05
questions.text: What is the function of a DX QSL Manager?
distractors: To run a net to allow many stations to contact a rare DX station
To relay calls to and from a DX station
questions.answer: To handle the receiving and sending of confirmation cards for a DX station

questions.label: E2C06
questions.text: During a VHF/UHF contest, in which band segment would you expect to find the highest level of activity?
distractors: At the top of each band, usually in a segment reserved for contests
In the middle of each band, usually on the national calling frequency
In the middle of the band, usually 25 kHz above the national calling frequency
questions.answer: In the weak signal segment of the band, with most of the activity near the calling frequency

questions.label: E2C07
questions.text: What is the Cabrillo format?
distractors: A method of exchanging information during a contest QSO
The most common set of contest rules
The rules of order for meetings between contest sponsors
questions.answer: A standard for submission of electronic contest logs

questions.label: E2C08
questions.text: Which of the following contacts may be confirmed through the U.S. QSL bureau system?
distractors: Special event contacts between stations in the U.S.
Repeater contacts between U.S. club members
questions.answer: Contacts between a U.S. station and a non-U.S. station

questions.label: E2C09
questions.text: What type of equipment is commonly used to implement a ham radio mesh network?
distractors: A 2 meter VHF transceiver with a 1200 baud modem
An optical cable connection between the USB ports of 2 separate computers
A 440 MHz transceiver with a 9600 baud modem
questions.answer: A standard wireless router running custom software

questions.label: E2C10
questions.text: Why might a DX station state that they are listening on another frequency?
distractors: Because the DX station may be transmitting on a frequency that is prohibited to some responding stations
To separate the calling stations from the DX station
To improve operating efficiency by reducing interference
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: E2C11
questions.text: How should you generally identify your station when attempting to contact a DX station during a contest or in a pileup?
distractors: Send only the last two letters of your call sign until you make contact
Send your full call sign and grid square
Send the call sign of the DX station three times, the words "this is", then your call sign three times
questions.answer: Send your full call sign once or twice

questions.label: E2C12
questions.text: What might help to restore contact when DX signals become too weak to copy across an entire HF band a few hours after sunset?
distractors: Switch to a higher frequency HF band
Wait 90 minutes or so for the signal degradation to pass
Wait 24 hours before attempting another communication on the band
questions.answer: Switch to a lower frequency HF band

questions.label: E2C13
questions.text: What indicator is required to be used by U.S.-licensed operators when operating a station via remote control where the transmitter is located in the U.S.?
distractors: / followed by the USPS two letter abbreviation for the state in which the remote station is located
/R# where # is the district of the remote station
The ARRL section of the remote station
questions.answer: No additional indicator is required

subTopics.label: E2D
subTopics.description: Operating methods: VHF and UHF digital modes and procedures; APRS; EME procedures, meteor scatter procedures

questions.label: E2D01
questions.text: Which of the following digital modes is especially designed for use for meteor scatter signals?
questions.answer: FSK441

questions.label: E2D02
questions.text: Which of the following is a good technique for making meteor scatter contacts?
distractors: 15 second timed transmission sequences with stations alternating based on location
Use of high speed CW or digital modes
Short transmission with rapidly repeated call signs and signal reports
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: E2D03
questions.text: Which of the following digital modes is especially useful for EME communications?
questions.answer: JT65

questions.label: E2D04
questions.text: What is the purpose of digital store-and-forward functions on an Amateur Radio satellite?
distractors: To upload operational software for the transponder
To delay download of telemetry between satellites
questions.answer: To store digital messages in the satellite for later download by other stations

questions.label: E2D05
questions.text: Which of the following techniques is normally used by low Earth orbiting digital satellites to relay messages around the world?
questions.answer: Store-and-forward

questions.label: E2D06
questions.text: Which of the following describes a method of establishing EME contacts?
distractors: Judging optimum transmission times by monitoring beacons reflected from the Moon
High speed CW identification to avoid fading
questions.answer: Time synchronous transmissions alternately from each station

questions.label: E2D07
questions.text: What digital protocol is used by APRS?
questions.answer: AX.25

questions.label: E2D08
questions.text: What type of packet frame is used to transmit APRS beacon data?
questions.answer: Unnumbered Information

questions.label: E2D09
questions.text: Which of these digital modes has the fastest data throughput under clear communication conditions?
questions.answer: 300 baud packet

questions.label: E2D10
questions.text: How can an APRS station be used to help support a public service communications activity?
distractors: An APRS station with an emergency medical technician can automatically transmit medical data to the nearest hospital
APRS stations with General Personnel Scanners can automatically relay the participant numbers and time as they pass the check points
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: An APRS station with a GPS unit can automatically transmit information to show a mobile station's position during the event

questions.label: E2D11
questions.text: Which of the following data are used by the APRS network to communicate your location?
questions.answer: Latitude and longitude

questions.label: E2D12
questions.text: How does JT65 improve EME communications?
distractors: It controls the receiver to track Doppler shift
It supplies signals to guide the antenna to track the Moon
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: It can decode signals many dB below the noise floor using FEC

questions.label: E2D13
questions.text: What type of modulation is used for JT65 contacts?
questions.answer: Multi-tone AFSK

questions.label: E2D14
questions.text: What is one advantage of using JT65 coding?
distractors: Easily copied by ear if necessary
Permits fast-scan TV transmissions over narrow bandwidth
questions.answer: The ability to decode signals which have a very low signal to noise ratio

subTopics.label: E2E
subTopics.description: Operating methods: operating HF digital modes

questions.label: E2E01
questions.text: Which type of modulation is common for data emissions below 30 MHz?
distractors: DTMF tones modulating an FM signal
questions.answer: FSK

questions.label: E2E02
questions.text: What do the letters FEC mean as they relate to digital operation?
questions.answer: Forward Error Correction

questions.label: E2E03
questions.text: How is the timing of JT65 contacts organized?
distractors: Stations take turns on alternate days
It depends on the lunar phase
questions.answer: Alternating transmissions at 1 minute intervals

questions.label: E2E04
questions.text: What is indicated when one of the ellipses in an FSK crossed-ellipse display suddenly disappears?
distractors: One of the signal filters is saturated
The receiver has drifted 5 kHz from the desired receive frequency
The mark and space signal have been inverted
questions.answer: Selective fading has occurred

questions.label: E2E05
questions.text: Which type of digital mode does not support keyboard-to-keyboard operation?
questions.answer: Winlink

questions.label: E2E06
questions.text: What is the most common data rate used for HF packet?
questions.answer: 300 baud

questions.label: E2E07
questions.text: What is the typical bandwidth of a properly modulated MFSK16 signal?
questions.answer: 316 Hz

questions.label: E2E08
questions.text: Which of the following HF digital modes can be used to transfer binary files?
questions.answer: PACTOR

questions.label: E2E09
questions.text: Which of the following HF digital modes uses variable-length coding for bandwidth efficiency?
questions.answer: PSK31

questions.label: E2E10
questions.text: Which of these digital modes has the narrowest bandwidth?
questions.answer: PSK31

questions.label: E2E11
questions.text: What is the difference between direct FSK and audio FSK?
distractors: Audio FSK has a superior frequency response
Direct FSK uses a DC-coupled data connection
Audio FSK can be performed anywhere in the transmit chain
questions.answer: Direct FSK applies the data signal to the transmitter VFO

questions.label: E2E12
questions.text: Which type of control is used by stations using the Automatic Link Enable (ALE) protocol?
distractors: ALE can use any type of control
questions.answer: Automatic

questions.label: E2E13
questions.text: Which of the following is a possible reason that attempts to initiate contact with a digital station on a clear frequency are unsuccessful?
distractors: The protocol version you are using is not supported by the digital station
Another station you are unable to hear is using the frequency
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

subTopics.label: E3A
subTopics.description: Electromagnetic waves; Earth-Moon-Earth communications; meteor scatter; microwave tropospheric and scatter propagation; aurora propagation

questions.label: E3A01
questions.text: What is the approximate maximum separation measured along the surface of the Earth between two stations communicating by Moon bounce?
distractors: 500 miles, if the Moon is at perigee
2000 miles, if the Moon is at apogee
5000 miles, if the Moon is at perigee
questions.answer: 12,000 miles, if the Moon is visible by both stations

questions.label: E3A02
questions.text: What characterizes libration fading of an EME signal?
distractors: A slow change in the pitch of the CW signal
A gradual loss of signal as the Sun rises
The returning echo is several hertz lower in frequency than the transmitted signal
questions.answer: A fluttery irregular fading

questions.label: E3A03
questions.text: When scheduling EME contacts, which of these conditions will generally result in the least path loss?
distractors: When the Moon is at apogee
When the MUF is above 30 MHz
questions.answer: When the Moon is at perigee

questions.label: E3A04
questions.text: What do Hepburn maps predict?
distractors: Likelihood of rain-scatter along cold or warm fronts
questions.answer: Probability of tropospheric propagation

questions.label: E3A05
questions.text: Tropospheric propagation of microwave signals often occurs along what weather related structure?
questions.answer: Warm and cold fronts

questions.label: E3A06
questions.text: Which of the following is required for microwave propagation via rain scatter?
distractors: Rain droplets must be electrically charged
Rain droplets must be within the E layer
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: The rain must be within radio range of both stations

questions.label: E3A07
questions.text: Atmospheric ducts capable of propagating microwave signals often form over what geographic feature?
questions.answer: Bodies of water

questions.label: E3A08
questions.text: When a meteor strikes the Earth's atmosphere, a cylindrical region of free electrons is formed at what layer of the ionosphere?
questions.answer: The E layer

questions.label: E3A09
questions.text: Which of the following frequency range is most suited for meteor scatter communications?
questions.answer: 28 MHz - 148 MHz

questions.label: E3A10
questions.text: Which type of atmospheric structure can create a path for microwave propagation?
questions.answer: Temperature inversion

questions.label: E3A11
questions.text: What is a typical range for tropospheric propagation of microwave signals?
questions.answer: 100 miles to 300 miles

questions.label: E3A12
questions.text: What is the cause of auroral activity?
distractors: The interaction in the F2 layer between the solar wind and the Van Allen belt
A low sunspot level combined with tropospheric ducting
Meteor showers concentrated in the extreme northern and southern latitudes
questions.answer: The interaction in the E layer of charged particles from the Sun with the Earth’s magnetic field

questions.label: E3A13
questions.text: Which emission mode is best for aurora propagation?
questions.answer: CW

questions.label: E3A14
questions.text: From the contiguous 48 states, in which approximate direction should an antenna be pointed to take maximum advantage of aurora propagation?
questions.answer: North

questions.label: E3A15
questions.text: What is an electromagnetic wave?
distractors: A wave of alternating current, in the core of an electromagnet
A wave consisting of two electric fields at parallel right angles to each other
A wave consisting of two magnetic fields at right angles to each other
questions.answer: A wave consisting of an electric field and a magnetic field oscillating at right angles to each other

questions.label: E3A16
questions.text: Which of the following best describes electromagnetic waves traveling in free space?
distractors: Electric and magnetic fields become aligned as they travel
The energy propagates through a medium with a high refractive index
The waves are reflected by the ionosphere and return to their source
questions.answer: Changing electric and magnetic fields propagate the energy

questions.label: E3A17
questions.text: What is meant by circularly polarized electromagnetic waves?
distractors: Waves with an electric field bent into a circular shape
Waves produced by a loop antenna
questions.answer: Waves with a rotating electric field

subTopics.label: E3B
subTopics.description: Transequatorial propagation; long path; gray-line; multi-path; ordinary and extraordinary waves; chordal hop, sporadic E mechanisms

questions.label: E3B01
questions.text: What is transequatorial propagation?
distractors: Propagation between any two points located on the magnetic equator
Propagation between two continents by way of ducts along the magnetic equator
Propagation between two stations at the same latitude
questions.answer: Propagation between two mid-latitude points at approximately the same distance north and south of the magnetic equator

questions.label: E3B02
questions.text: What is the approximate maximum range for signals using transequatorial propagation?
questions.answer: 5000 miles

questions.label: E3B03
questions.text: What is the best time of day for transequatorial propagation?
questions.answer: Afternoon or early evening

questions.label: E3B04
questions.text: What is meant by the terms extraordinary and ordinary waves?
distractors: Extraordinary waves describe rare long skip propagation compared to ordinary waves which travel shorter distances
Long path and short path waves
questions.answer: Independent waves created in the ionosphere that are elliptically polarized

questions.label: E3B05
questions.text: Which amateur bands typically support long-path propagation?
questions.answer: 160 meters to 10 meters

questions.label: E3B06
questions.text: Which of the following amateur bands most frequently provides long-path propagation?
questions.answer: 20 meters

questions.label: E3B07
questions.text: Which of the following could account for hearing an echo on the received signal of a distant station?
distractors: Transmit frequency is higher than the MUF
questions.answer: Receipt of a signal by more than one path

questions.label: E3B08
questions.text: What type of HF propagation is probably occurring if radio signals travel along the terminator between daylight and darkness?
questions.answer: Gray-line

questions.label: E3B09
questions.text: At what time of year is Sporadic E propagation most likely to occur?
distractors: Around the solstices, especially the winter solstice
Around the equinoxes, especially the spring equinox
Around the equinoxes, especially the fall equinox
questions.answer: Around the solstices, especially the summer solstice

questions.label: E3B10
questions.text: What is the cause of gray-line propagation?
distractors: At midday, the Sun super heats the ionosphere causing increased refraction of radio waves
In darkness, solar absorption drops greatly while atmospheric ionization remains steady
At mid-afternoon, the Sun heats the ionosphere decreasing radio wave refraction and the MUF
questions.answer: At twilight and sunrise, D-layer absorption is low while E-layer and F-layer propagation remains high

questions.label: E3B11
questions.text: At what time of day is Sporadic-E propagation most likely to occur?
questions.answer: Any time

questions.label: E3B12
questions.text: What is the primary characteristic of chordal hop propagation?
distractors: Propagation away from the great circle bearing between stations
Signals reflected back toward the transmitting station
questions.answer: Successive ionospheric reflections without an intermediate reflection from the ground

questions.label: E3B13
questions.text: Why is chordal hop propagation desirable?
distractors: The MUF for chordal hop propagation is much lower than for normal skip propagation
Atmospheric noise is lower in the direction of chordal hop propagation
Signals travel faster along ionospheric chords
questions.answer: The signal experiences less loss along the path compared to normal skip propagation

questions.label: E3B14
questions.text: What happens to linearly polarized radio waves that split into ordinary and extraordinary waves in the ionosphere?
distractors: They are bent toward the magnetic poles
questions.answer: They become elliptically polarized

subTopics.label: E3C
subTopics.description: Radio-path horizon; less common propagation modes; propagation prediction techniques and modeling; space weather parameters and amateur radio

questions.label: E3C01
questions.text: What does the term ray tracing describe in regard to radio communications?
distractors: The process in which an electronic display presents a pattern
Determining the radiation pattern from an array of antennas
Evaluating high voltage sources for X-Rays
questions.answer: Modeling a radio wave's path through the ionosphere

questions.label: E3C02
questions.text: What is indicated by a rising A or K index?
distractors: Decreasing disruption of the geomagnetic field
Higher levels of solar UV radiation
An increase in the critical frequency
questions.answer: Increasing disruption of the geomagnetic field

questions.label: E3C03
questions.text: Which of the following signal paths is most likely to experience high levels of absorption when the A index or K index is elevated?
questions.answer: Polar paths

questions.label: E3C04
questions.text: What does the value of Bz (B sub Z) represent?
questions.answer: Direction and strength of the interplanetary magnetic field

questions.label: E3C05
questions.text: What orientation of Bz (B sub z) increases the likelihood that incoming particles from the Sun will cause disturbed conditions?
questions.answer: Southward

questions.label: E3C06
questions.text: By how much does the VHF/UHF radio horizon distance exceed the geometric horizon?
distractors: By approximately 50 percent of the distance
By approximately four times the distance
questions.answer: By approximately 15 percent of the distance

questions.label: E3C07
questions.text: Which of the following descriptors indicates the greatest solar flare intensity?
questions.answer: Class X

questions.label: E3C08
questions.text: What does the space weather term G5 mean?
questions.answer: An extreme geomagnetic storm

questions.label: E3C09
questions.text: How does the intensity of an X3 flare compare to that of an X2 flare?
questions.answer: Twice as great

questions.label: E3C10
questions.text: What does the 304A solar parameter measure?
distractors: The ratio of X-Ray flux to radio flux, correlated to sunspot number
The solar wind velocity at 304 degrees from the solar equator, correlated to solar activity
The solar emission at 304 GHz, correlated to X-Ray flare levels
questions.answer: UV emissions at 304 angstroms, correlated to solar flux index

questions.label: E3C11
questions.text: What does VOACAP software model?
questions.answer: HF propagation

questions.label: E3C12
questions.text: How does the maximum distance of ground-wave propagation change when the signal frequency is increased?
questions.answer: It decreases

questions.label: E3C13
questions.text: What type of polarization is best for ground-wave propagation?
questions.answer: Vertical

questions.label: E3C14
questions.text: Why does the radio-path horizon distance exceed the geometric horizon?
distractors: Downward bending due to aurora refraction
questions.answer: Downward bending due to density variations in the atmosphere

questions.label: E3C15
questions.text: What might a sudden rise in radio background noise indicate?
questions.answer: A solar flare has occurred

subTopics.label: E4A
subTopics.description: Test equipment: analog and digital instruments; spectrum and network analyzers, antenna analyzers; oscilloscopes; RF measurements; computer aided measurements

questions.label: E4A01
questions.text: Which of the following parameters determines the bandwidth of a digital or computer-based oscilloscope?
questions.answer: Sampling rate

questions.label: E4A02
questions.text: Which of the following parameters would a spectrum analyzer display on the vertical and horizontal axes?
questions.answer: RF amplitude and frequency

questions.label: E4A03
questions.text: Which of the following test instruments is used to display spurious signals and/or intermodulation distortion products in an SSB transmitter?
questions.answer: A spectrum analyzer

questions.label: E4A04
questions.text: What determines the upper frequency limit for a computer soundcard-based oscilloscope program?
distractors: Amount of memory on the soundcard
Q of the interface of the interface circuit
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Analog-to-digital conversion speed of the soundcard

questions.label: E4A05
questions.text: What might be an advantage of a digital vs an analog oscilloscope?
distractors: Automatic amplitude and frequency numerical readout
Storage of traces for future reference
Manipulation of time base after trace capture
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: E4A06
questions.text: What is the effect of aliasing in a digital or computer-based oscilloscope?
distractors: All signals will have a DC offset
Calibration of the vertical scale is no longer valid
questions.answer: False signals are displayed

questions.label: E4A07
questions.text: Which of the following is an advantage of using an antenna analyzer compared to an SWR bridge to measure antenna SWR?
distractors: Antenna analyzers automatically tune your antenna for resonance
Antenna analyzers display a time-varying representation of the modulation envelope
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Antenna analyzers do not need an external RF source

questions.label: E4A08
questions.text: Which of the following instruments would be best for measuring the SWR of a beam antenna?
questions.answer: An antenna analyzer

questions.label: E4A09
questions.text: When using a computer’s soundcard input to digitize signals, what is the highest frequency signal that can be digitized without aliasing?
distractors: The same as the sample rate
It depends on how the data is stored internally
questions.answer: One-half the sample rate

questions.label: E4A10
questions.text: Which of the following displays multiple digital signal states simultaneously?
questions.answer: Logic analyzer

questions.label: E4A11
questions.text: Which of the following is good practice when using an oscilloscope probe?
distractors: Never use a high impedance probe to measure a low impedance circuit
Never use a DC-coupled probe to measure an AC circuit
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Keep the signal ground connection of the probe as short as possible

questions.label: E4A12
questions.text: Which of the following procedures is an important precaution to follow when connecting a spectrum analyzer to a transmitter output?
distractors: Use high quality double shielded coaxial cables to reduce signal losses
Match the antenna to the load
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Attenuate the transmitter output going to the spectrum analyzer

questions.label: E4A13
questions.text: How is the compensation of an oscilloscope probe typically adjusted?
distractors: A high frequency sine wave is displayed and the probe is adjusted for maximum amplitude
A frequency standard is displayed and the probe is adjusted until the deflection time is accurate
A DC voltage standard is displayed and the probe is adjusted until the displayed voltage is accurate
questions.answer: A square wave is displayed and the probe is adjusted until the horizontal portions of the displayed wave are as nearly flat as possible

questions.label: E4A14
questions.text: What is the purpose of the prescaler function on a frequency counter?
distractors: It amplifies low level signals for more accurate counting
It multiplies a higher frequency signal so a low-frequency counter can display the operating frequency
It prevents oscillation in a low-frequency counter circuit
questions.answer: It divides a higher frequency signal so a low-frequency counter can display the input frequency

questions.label: E4A15
questions.text: What is an advantage of a period-measuring frequency counter over a direct-count type?
distractors: It can run on battery power for remote measurements
It does not require an expensive high-precision time base
It can directly measure the modulation index of an FM transmitter
questions.answer: It provides improved resolution of low-frequency signals within a comparable time period

subTopics.label: E4B
subTopics.description: Measurement technique and limitations: instrument accuracy and performance limitations; probes; techniques to minimize errors; measurement of "Q"; instrument calibration; S parameters; vector network analyzers

questions.label: E4B01
questions.text: Which of the following factors most affects the accuracy of a frequency counter?
questions.answer: Time base accuracy

questions.label: E4B02
questions.text: What is an advantage of using a bridge circuit to measure impedance?
distractors: It provides an excellent match under all conditions
It is relatively immune to drift in the signal generator source
It can display results directly in Smith chart format
questions.answer: It is very precise in obtaining a signal null

questions.label: E4B03
questions.text: If a frequency counter with a specified accuracy of +/- 1.0 ppm reads 146,520,000 Hz, what is the most the actual frequency being measured could differ from the reading?

questions.label: E4B04
questions.text: If a frequency counter with a specified accuracy of +/- 0.1 ppm reads 146,520,000 Hz, what is the most the actual frequency being measured could differ from the reading?

questions.label: E4B05
questions.text: If a frequency counter with a specified accuracy of +/- 10 ppm reads 146,520,000 Hz, what is the most the actual frequency being measured could differ from the reading?

questions.label: E4B06
questions.text: How much power is being absorbed by the load when a directional power meter connected between a transmitter and a terminating load reads 100 watts forward power and 25 watts reflected power?
questions.answer: 75 watts

questions.label: E4B07
questions.text: What do the subscripts of S parameters represent?
questions.answer: The port or ports at which measurements are made

questions.label: E4B08
questions.text: Which of the following is a characteristic of a good DC voltmeter?
questions.answer: High impedance input

questions.label: E4B09
questions.text: What is indicated if the current reading on an RF ammeter placed in series with the antenna feed line of a transmitter increases as the transmitter is tuned to resonance?
distractors: There is possibly a short to ground in the feed line
The transmitter is not properly neutralized
There is an impedance mismatch between the antenna and feed line
questions.answer: There is more power going into the antenna

questions.label: E4B10
questions.text: Which of the following describes a method to measure intermodulation distortion in an SSB transmitter?
distractors: Modulate the transmitter with two non-harmonically related radio frequencies and observe the RF output with a spectrum analyzer
Modulate the transmitter with two harmonically related audio frequencies and observe the RF output with a peak reading wattmeter
Modulate the transmitter with two harmonically related audio frequencies and observe the RF output with a logic analyzer
questions.answer: Modulate the transmitter with two non-harmonically related audio frequencies and observe the RF output with a spectrum analyzer

questions.label: E4B11
questions.text: How should an antenna analyzer be connected when measuring antenna resonance and feed point impedance?
distractors: Loosely couple the analyzer near the antenna base
Connect the analyzer via a high-impedance transformer to the antenna
Loosely couple the antenna and a dummy load to the analyzer
questions.answer: Connect the antenna feed line directly to the analyzer's connector

questions.label: E4B12
questions.text: What is the significance of voltmeter sensitivity expressed in ohms per volt?
distractors: When used as a galvanometer, the reading in volts multiplied by the ohms per volt rating will determine the power drawn by the device under test
When used as an ohmmeter, the reading in ohms divided by the ohms per volt rating will determine the voltage applied to the circuit
When used as an ammeter, the full scale reading in amps divided by ohms per volt rating will determine the size of shunt needed
questions.answer: The full scale reading of the voltmeter multiplied by its ohms per volt rating will indicate the input impedance of the voltmeter

questions.label: E4B13
questions.text: Which S parameter is equivalent to forward gain?

questions.label: E4B14
questions.text: What happens if a dip meter is too tightly coupled to a tuned circuit being checked?
questions.answer: A less accurate reading results

questions.label: E4B15
questions.text: Which of the following can be used as a relative measurement of the Q for a series-tuned circuit?
distractors: The resonant frequency of the circuit
questions.answer: The bandwidth of the circuit's frequency response

questions.label: E4B16
questions.text: Which S parameter represents return loss or SWR?

questions.label: E4B17
questions.text: What three test loads are used to calibrate a standard RF vector network analyzer?
distractors: Short circuit, open circuit, and resonant circuit
50 ohms through 1/8 wavelength, 1/4 wavelength, and 1/2 wavelength of coaxial cable
questions.answer: Short circuit, open circuit, and 50 ohms

subTopics.label: E4C
subTopics.description: Receiver performance characteristics, phase noise, noise floor, image rejection, MDS, signal-to-noise-ratio; selectivity; effects of SDR receiver non-linearity

questions.label: E4C01
questions.text: What is an effect of excessive phase noise in the local oscillator section of a receiver?
distractors: It limits the receiver’s ability to receive strong signals
It decreases receiver third-order intermodulation distortion dynamic range
questions.answer: It can cause strong signals on nearby frequencies to interfere with reception of weak signals

questions.label: E4C02
questions.text: Which of the following portions of a receiver can be effective in eliminating image signal interference?
questions.answer: A front-end filter or pre-selector

questions.label: E4C03
questions.text: What is the term for the blocking of one FM phone signal by another, stronger FM phone signal?
questions.answer: Capture effect

questions.label: E4C04
questions.text: How is the noise figure of a receiver defined?
distractors: The ratio of atmospheric noise to phase noise
The ratio of the noise bandwidth in Hertz to the theoretical bandwidth of a resistive network
The ratio of thermal noise to atmospheric noise
questions.answer: The ratio in dB of the noise generated by the receiver to the theoretical minimum noise

questions.label: E4C05
questions.text: What does a value of -174 dBm/Hz represent with regard to the noise floor of a receiver?
distractors: The minimum detectable signal as a function of receive frequency
The noise figure of a 1 Hz bandwidth receiver
The galactic noise contribution to minimum detectable signal
questions.answer: The theoretical noise at the input of a perfect receiver at room temperature

questions.label: E4C06
questions.text: A CW receiver with the AGC off has an equivalent input noise power density of -174 dBm/Hz. What would be the level of an unmodulated carrier input to this receiver that would yield an audio output SNR of 0 dB in a 400 Hz noise bandwidth?
questions.answer: -148 dBm

questions.label: E4C07
questions.text: What does the MDS of a receiver represent?
questions.answer: The minimum discernible signal

questions.label: E4C08
questions.text: An SDR receiver is overloaded when input signals exceed what level?
distractors: One-half the maximum sampling buffer size
The reference voltage of the analog-to-digital converter
questions.answer: The maximum count value of the analog-to-digital converter

questions.label: E4C09
questions.text: Which of the following choices is a good reason for selecting a high frequency for the design of the IF in a conventional HF or VHF communications receiver?
questions.answer: Easier for front-end circuitry to eliminate image responses

questions.label: E4C10
questions.text: Which of the following is a desirable amount of selectivity for an amateur RTTY HF receiver?
questions.answer: 300 Hz

questions.label: E4C11
questions.text: Which of the following is a desirable amount of selectivity for an amateur SSB phone receiver?
questions.answer: 2.4 kHz

questions.label: E4C12
questions.text: What is an undesirable effect of using too wide a filter bandwidth in the IF section of a receiver?
questions.answer: Undesired signals may be heard

questions.label: E4C13
questions.text: How does a narrow-band roofing filter affect receiver performance?
distractors: It improves sensitivity by reducing front end noise
It improves intelligibility by using low Q circuitry to reduce ringing
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: It improves dynamic range by attenuating strong signals near the receive frequency

questions.label: E4C14
questions.text: What transmit frequency might generate an image response signal in a receiver tuned to 14.300 MHz and which uses a 455 kHz IF frequency?

questions.label: E4C15
questions.text: What is usually the primary source of noise that is heard from an HF receiver with an antenna connected?
questions.answer: Atmospheric noise

questions.label: E4C16
questions.text: Which of the following is caused by missing codes in an SDR receiver’s analog-to-digital converter?
questions.answer: Distortion

questions.label: E4C17
questions.text: Which of the following has the largest effect on an SDR receiver’s linearity?
distractors: RAM speed used for data storage
questions.answer: Analog-to-digital converter sample width in bits

subTopics.label: E4D
subTopics.description: Receiver performance characteristics: blocking dynamic range; intermodulation and cross-modulation interference; 3rd order intercept; desensitization; preselector

questions.label: E4D01
questions.text: What is meant by the blocking dynamic range of a receiver?
distractors: The minimum difference in dB between the levels of two FM signals which will cause one signal to block the other
The difference in dB between the noise floor and the third order intercept point
The minimum difference in dB between two signals which produce third order intermodulation products greater than the noise floor
questions.answer: The difference in dB between the noise floor and the level of an incoming signal which will cause 1 dB of gain compression

questions.label: E4D02
questions.text: Which of the following describes two problems caused by poor dynamic range in a communications receiver?
distractors: Oscillator instability requiring frequent retuning and loss of ability to recover the opposite sideband
Cross-modulation of the desired signal and insufficient audio power to operate the speaker
Oscillator instability and severe audio distortion of all but the strongest received signals
questions.answer: Cross-modulation of the desired signal and desensitization from strong adjacent signals

questions.label: E4D03
questions.text: How can intermodulation interference between two repeaters occur?
distractors: When the repeaters are in close proximity and the signals cause feedback in the final amplifier of one or both transmitters
When the signals from the transmitters are reflected out of phase from airplanes passing overhead
When the signals from the transmitters are reflected in phase from airplanes passing overhead
questions.answer: When the repeaters are in close proximity and the signals mix in the final amplifier of one or both transmitters

questions.label: E4D04
questions.text: Which of the following may reduce or eliminate intermodulation interference in a repeater caused by another transmitter operating in close proximity?
distractors: A band-pass filter in the feed line between the transmitter and receiver
questions.answer: A properly terminated circulator at the output of the transmitter

questions.label: E4D05
questions.text: What transmitter frequencies would cause an intermodulation-product signal in a receiver tuned to 146.70 MHz when a nearby station transmits on 146.52 MHz?
questions.answer: 146.34 MHz and 146.61 MHz

questions.label: E4D06
questions.text: What is the term for unwanted signals generated by the mixing of two or more signals?
questions.answer: Intermodulation interference

questions.label: E4D07
questions.text: Which describes the most significant effect of an off-frequency signal when it is causing cross-modulation interference to a desired signal?
distractors: A large increase in background noise
A reduction in apparent signal strength
The desired signal can no longer be heard
questions.answer: The off-frequency unwanted signal is heard in addition to the desired signal

questions.label: E4D08
questions.text: What causes intermodulation in an electronic circuit?
questions.answer: Nonlinear circuits or devices

questions.label: E4D09
